description.text:
Turkish Student Association at NC State is organizing Turkish Music and Dance Night on Saturday, March 31st at Talley Student Union - BR Mountain Ballroom, 6pm.
There will be live music bands, belly dancers, traditional dance group, Dj, authentic dinner , refreshments, competitions, and raffle.
Our biggest prizes for raffle are 2 x round trip flight tickets from USA to Turkey with Turkish Airlines. Raffle tickets will be available on site.
Admission is $10 for adults, $7 for students and $5 for Children (age 4+)- tickets are nonrefundable.
Any concern or question please contact with turkishassociation@ncsu.edu
description.html:

Our biggest prizes for raffle are 2 x round trip flight tickets from USA to Turkey with Turkish Airlines. Raffle tickets will be available on site.

Admission is $10 for adults, $7 for students and $5 for Children (age 4+)- tickets are nonrefundable.

Any concern or question please contact with turkishassociation@ncsu.edu

name.text: Live Country Music with Silver Wings!
name.html: Live Country Music with Silver Wings!

description.text:
Silver Wings at Comedy Zone of Clayton March 30, 2018





Advanced tickets $10, $15 Day of Show



Showtime 8PMDoors Open 7PM
Base ticket pices Do not include taxes and fees. 2 item minimumQuestions, call BOX OFFICE AT 919-243-2547










About Silver Wings


Silver Wings is a country band based out of Durham, NC. They play a heavy dose of traditional country music seasoned with some classic rock, spice it up with a few beach tunes, and even throw in some Motown sounds to keep things interesting. Come out to hear some of the tunes you were raised on!

name.text: Clever Measures/ Smoke From All The Friction/ Retro Candy
name.html: Clever Measures/ Smoke From All The Friction/ Retro Candy

description.text: Come on out to Deep South for a Saturday night of fantastic local music! On the line-up, we have.....Smoke From All The Friction blends traditional and underground cultures to create a fusion of dark pop, rock, and indie electronic that grabs listeners with both a sense of familiarity and a striking curiosity. Inspired by the ideas of tension and friction, they seek to explore what happens when we venture outside ourselves, past the abstract social constructs that create barriers between us. Instead of simply creating a musical performance for mere entertainment, they inspire a deeper, thought-provoking appreciation between the audience and the music itself. Clever Measures is an exciting sonic concoction of Alt Rock, Pop Punk, and Classic Rock. From the songwriting sensibilities that make today's pop rock so catchy, to the infectiously engaging high energy Pop Punk of the 90's and 2000's, all the way to the guitar virtuosity that has given classic rock the staying power to remain ever present on the radio and in our souls. Nothing hits your ears sweeter than Retro Candy. Take a trip to the past, let your hair down, have a sweet time. With a great blend of new music and nostalgic sounds, Retro Candy is sure to show you a great time!
description.html:
Come on out to Deep South for a Saturday night of fantastic local music! On the line-up, we have.....

Smoke From All The Friction blends traditional and underground cultures to create a fusion of dark pop, rock, and indie electronic that grabs listeners with both a sense of familiarity and a striking curiosity. Inspired by the ideas of tension and friction, they seek to explore what happens when we venture outside ourselves, past the abstract social constructs that create barriers between us. Instead of simply creating a musical performance for mere entertainment, they inspire a deeper, thought-provoking appreciation between the audience and the music itself. 

Clever Measures is an exciting sonic concoction of Alt Rock, Pop Punk, and Classic Rock. From the songwriting sensibilities that make today's pop rock so catchy, to the infectiously engaging high energy Pop Punk of the 90's and 2000's, all the way to the guitar virtuosity that has given classic rock the staying power to remain ever present on the radio and in our souls. 

Nothing hits your ears sweeter than Retro Candy. Take a trip to the past, let your hair down, have a sweet time. With a great blend of new music and nostalgic sounds, Retro Candy is sure to show you a great time!

description.text: The inimitable Thomas Waller rose to international fame during the Golden Age of the Cotton Club and that new beat, swing music. Although not quite a biography, Ain't Misbehavin' evokes the delightful humor and infectious energy of this American original as a versatile cast struts, strums and sings the songs that he made famous in a career that ranged from uptown clubs to downtown Tin Pan Alley to Hollywood and concert stages in the U.S., Canada and Europe.

description.text: I invite you all the THE VIBE CLUB where I will be hosting an intimate concert series. The attire is comfortable. Feel free to bring bean bags, pillows, blankets, your favorite teddy - whatever puts you in that chill mood when you are in your room with your headphones in, favorite songs bumping. I will have incense burning as I perform for you some of my favorite joints. It will be a night of Soul Music. Buy your tickets now, as spots are limited!

description.text: Jon Shain is a veteran singer-songwriter who's been turning heads for years with his words, his fiery acoustic guitar work, and his evolved musical style - combining improvised piedmont blues with bluegrass, swing, and ragtime. Shain’s latest disc, a duet album with Joe Newberry, Crow the Dawn, was released in January, 2016. Shain is currently at work on a new recording project with long-time collaborator FJ Ventre. Jon also played on two records by Jim Avett, father of Seth and Scott Avett.Jon grew up in Haverhill, Massachusetts, a Merrimack River mill-town that had already seen its better days by the time he was a child in the 1970s. His family’s business was a small textile dyeing company, and he worked in the factory during the summers throughout his teens. At the same time, Shain began to discover his love of American roots music and songwriting, specifically drawn to the narratives about regular people and themes of social justice.Shain headed south to North Carolina in 1986, to study American History at Duke University and to continue his musical journey, as well. In addition to studying with jazz professor Paul Jeffrey, he also had the good fortune to learn the piedmont blues tradition firsthand by playing in Big Boy Henry’s backing band. It was at this time that Shain also got to meet and play with John Dee Holeman and a number of the great older NC blues players. Shain's classes in school were heavily concentrated in southern history, English, and world religions. That mixture of the academic environment and the real-world blues music is what has most informed his musical direction.Shain cut his touring teeth from 1989-1998 founding the Chapel Hill, NC folk-rock group, Flyin' Mice and their spin-off group, WAKE. The band performed with acts such as David Grisman, Tony Rice Unit, Hot Tuna, and the Dixie Dregs, released four CDs, and played clubs, schools, and festivals up and down the East Coast, building a legion of fans.After his band's breakup, Shain went solo, returning to his roots in the folk and blues circuit. In addition to the album with Joe Newberry and a live album with Jon Shain Trio, Jon has released eight studio albums, working with studio luminaries such as Dave Mattacks, Tom Dube, and Chris Stamey, along the way. As a guest artist, Jon has recorded with Jim Avett, Greg Humphreys, Dana Kletter, and many others and his instrumental music has been placed in several documentary films and commercials, as well as on shows on the Discovery Channel and Animal Planet.The last few years have seen Shain headlining listening rooms on the East Coast, in the Midwest, and in Europe, as well as opening shows for John Hiatt, Keb’ Mo’, Little Feat, and others. When Shain is not recording, producing other artists, or performing, he stays busy giving private instruction in Piedmont blues fingerstyle guitar, and teaching group workshops in songwriting and blues guitar.
description.html:
Jon Shain is a veteran singer-songwriter who's been turning heads for years with his words, his fiery acoustic guitar work, and his evolved musical style - combining improvised piedmont blues with bluegrass, swing, and ragtime. Shain’s latest disc, a duet album with Joe Newberry, Crow the Dawn, was released in January, 2016. Shain is currently at work on a new recording project with long-time collaborator FJ Ventre. Jon also played on two records by Jim Avett, father of Seth and Scott Avett.

Jon grew up in Haverhill, Massachusetts, a Merrimack River mill-town that had already seen its better days by the time he was a child in the 1970s. His family’s business was a small textile dyeing company, and he worked in the factory during the summers throughout his teens. At the same time, Shain began to discover his love of American roots music and songwriting, specifically drawn to the narratives about regular people and themes of social justice.

Shain headed south to North Carolina in 1986, to study American History at Duke University and to continue his musical journey, as well. In addition to studying with jazz professor Paul Jeffrey, he also had the good fortune to learn the piedmont blues tradition firsthand by playing in Big Boy Henry’s backing band. It was at this time that Shain also got to meet and play with John Dee Holeman and a number of the great older NC blues players. Shain's classes in school were heavily concentrated in southern history, English, and world religions. That mixture of the academic environment and the real-world blues music is what has most informed his musical direction.

Shain cut his touring teeth from 1989-1998 founding the Chapel Hill, NC folk-rock group, Flyin' Mice and their spin-off group, WAKE. The band performed with acts such as David Grisman, Tony Rice Unit, Hot Tuna, and the Dixie Dregs, released four CDs, and played clubs, schools, and festivals up and down the East Coast, building a legion of fans.

After his band's breakup, Shain went solo, returning to his roots in the folk and blues circuit. In addition to the album with Joe Newberry and a live album with Jon Shain Trio, Jon has released eight studio albums, working with studio luminaries such as Dave Mattacks, Tom Dube, and Chris Stamey, along the way. As a guest artist, Jon has recorded with Jim Avett, Greg Humphreys, Dana Kletter, and many others and his instrumental music has been placed in several documentary films and commercials, as well as on shows on the Discovery Channel and Animal Planet.

The last few years have seen Shain headlining listening rooms on the East Coast, in the Midwest, and in Europe, as well as opening shows for John Hiatt, Keb’ Mo’, Little Feat, and others. When Shain is not recording, producing other artists, or performing, he stays busy giving private instruction in Piedmont blues fingerstyle guitar, and teaching group workshops in songwriting and blues guitar.

name.html: Brian Dawson Presents- Solas On Fridays!!!!

description.text: Friday nights haven't been the same since BD Entertainment started Solas On Fridays. It is the most talked about night in the city! With 2 floors, 3 DJ's, and music that includes R&B/Crossover and Top 40/International, not to mention, the host- K97.5's Brian Dawson, there's something that will fit the taste of any party-goer in the Triangle. Dancing and partying the night away at Solas On Fridays is sure to make your night a happy one; so grab your friends, get dressed up, register and get in the mix at #SolasOnFridays!

name.text: Madison Jay's Sound Reception for "Line Em Up"
name.html: Madison Jay's Sound Reception for "Line Em Up"

description.text:
You all are cordially invited to join us at RedLine Recording Studios, as we have a sound reception for Madison Jay and his new single "Line Em Up". Throughout the evening you'll enjoy a mellow atmosphere with light food and beverage courtesy of the company. You'll be encouraged to mix and mingle with other attendees, network and introduce yourself to as many people as possible. You'll have the opportunity to meet and greet with Madison Jay, as he'll be answering any questions concerning his upcoming project. The peak of the night will be highlighted by the world premiere of Madison Jay's new music video "Line Em Up" directed by Joseph "Headgraphix" Headen for A-Side Entertainment.

Please RSVP if you plan on attending... SPACE IS LIMITED!
Note: The address will be emailed after you RSVP.

description.text:
The Passage Church would like to invite you to come experience the Wendell, NC Egg Hunt! This year's event will be the biggest yet. Come spend the day in the town of Wendell and see what this amazing town has to offer. The Egg Hunt activities will begin at 10:00am and finish up around 12:00pm. We'll have inflatable bounce houses, face painting, music & more! 
After the hunt you can check out some of our local downtown businesses for lunch, or head out to Wendell Falls and grab a bite. You can swing by our award winning coffee shop 41 North, and get some ice cream at the Wendell General Store. Another fun activity in Wendell is #wendellrocks. Take your kids on a scavenger hunt in downtown Wendell and find some of the coolest painted rocks you've ever seen! 
Come on out to the Wendell Egg Hunt on March 31, 2018 and experience our small town, with big charm.

description.text:
Do you want to learn Spanish? Do you travel to Spanish-speaking countries? Would knowing Spanish be helpful for your job? Is learning Spanish on your Bucket List? Why wait?
Spanish for Adults
6-week, 9 hour class for $90
When: Tuesdays 6:00-7:30pm March 27th through May 1st 
Where: Hatch Coworking Office 104 South White St. Wake Forest, NC 27587
Does the thought of memorizing long lists of words make you dizzy? Do you still have nightmares of verb conjugation drills? Comprehension and understanding will be our focus - NOT Grammar and conjugation.
Certified Spanish teacher, Tony Williams, will be leading this dynamic and highly-engaging class using the latest language-acquisition research. Teaching Proficiency through Reading and Storytelling, or TPRS, targets the 100 most frequently used words in the Spanish language - NOT long lists of words to memorize. Spanish is taught in context through stories that are both understandable and entertaining. Class stories can be generated together as a group, come from a book, photo, video clip or movie.
Several different websites, podcasts, apps, videos, music, TV shows and movies will be presented for practice outside of class. In addition, participants will borrow books from the class library for outside reading. Workbook included.
For further information, text or call 919-729-2480 or email tony@v1da.net.
description.html:
Do you want to learn Spanish? Do you travel to Spanish-speaking countries? Would knowing Spanish be helpful for your job? Is learning Spanish on your Bucket List? Why wait?

Spanish for Adults

6-week, 9 hour class for $90

When: Tuesdays 6:00-7:30pm March 27th through May 1st

Where: Hatch Coworking Office 104 South White St. Wake Forest, NC 27587

Does the thought of memorizing long lists of words make you dizzy? Do you still have nightmares of verb conjugation drills? Comprehension and understanding will be our focus - NOT Grammar and conjugation.

Certified Spanish teacher, Tony Williams, will be leading this dynamic and highly-engaging class using the latest language-acquisition research. Teaching Proficiency through Reading and Storytelling, or TPRS, targets the 100 most frequently used words in the Spanish language - NOT long lists of words to memorize. Spanish is taught in context through stories that are both understandable and entertaining. Class stories can be generated together as a group, come from a book, photo, video clip or movie.

Several different websites, podcasts, apps, videos, music, TV shows and movies will be presented for practice outside of class. In addition, participants will borrow books from the class library for outside reading. Workbook included.

For further information, text or call 919-729-2480 or email tony@v1da.net.

address.localized_address_display: 104 South White Street, Wake Forest, NC 27587

description.text:
Do you want to learn Spanish? Do you travel to Spanish-speaking countries? Would knowing Spanish be helpful for your job? Is learning Spanish on your Bucket List? Why wait?
Spanish for Adults
6-week, 9 hour class for $90
When: Thursdays 6:30-8:00pm March 29th through May 3rd
Where: The Rusted Hinge Marketplace, 106 E. Vance St. Zebulon, NC 27597
Does the thought of memorizing long lists of words make you dizzy? Do you still have nightmares of verb conjugation drills? Comprehension and understanding will be our focus - NOT Grammar and conjugation.
Certified Spanish teacher, Tony Williams, will be leading this dynamic and highly-engaging class using the latest language-acquisition research. Teaching Proficiency through Reading and Storytelling, or TPRS, targets the 100 most frequently used words in the Spanish language - NOT long lists of words to memorize. Spanish is taught in context through stories that are both understandable and entertaining. Class stories can be generated together as a group, come from a book, photo, video clip or movie.
Several different websites, podcasts, apps, videos, music, TV shows and movies will be presented for practice outside of class. In addition, participants will borrow books from the class library for outside reading. Workbook included.
For further information, text or call 919-729-2480 or email tony@v1da.net.
